monthly_revenue.note: ~$300/month from 300 crops in 25m² tent. Projected to increase with 126m² expansion

profit_margin.gross_margin: ~85% after electricity, water, nutrient solutions (50% costs)
profit_margin.note: Will improve significantly with solar power (currently main cost is electricity)

expansion_status.status: Setting up electrical, water, land infrastructure

expansion_achievement.label: proud_accomplished
evidence: Scaled from 25m² to 126m² with Bloom + Berytech funding

solar_energy_urgency.label: necessary_investment_anxious
evidence: Want renewable energy to not harm environment
Cost is personal burden but knows it will have good return long-term

bloom_program.label: grateful_supportive
evidence: Bloom funding helped them make shift at good timing

cooperative_idea.label: interested_fair_minded
evidence: Said grouping by revenue tiers (small/medium/large) would be more fair

explicit_needs.evidence: Need 10 amps power. Requires ~10 solar panels + batteries + inverter. Cost: $2,500-$3,000
explicit_needs.willingness_to_pay: Yes but would take time to accumulate from sales revenue

explicit_needs.evidence: Bilal suggested: temp/humidity sensors, automatic pumps on timers, remote monitoring. 'Weekend project' for someone with electronics/programming skills
Future plan to sell hydroponics systems (not just vegetables) to schools, universities, households

implied_needs.inference: Just completed infrastructure scale-up, need to do financial planning and study on new scale. Not yet producing from larger tent
Bilal suggested GoFundMe/crowdfunding for solar panels. Ghinwa receptive. Could reach Bloom's 14,000 person network
implied_needs.bilal_idea: Tiered crowdfunding: $5K for solar, $15K for solar+tent, $30K for full expansion

implied_needs.inference: Bilal offered to pilot home hydroponics setup at his Beirut house (Beit Al Atlas) if Ghinwa designs modular product

core_values.evidence: Want renewable energy even though costly personally. 'Don't want to harm environment.' Organic hydroponics focus
Focus on clean vegetables, educating community about hydroponics benefits. 'Eat the rainbow' nutrition concept
Secret sauce: Introducing hydroponics concept to community. Education before sales. Future: sell systems to schools/universities
Dream big but grow step by step. Baby steps. Full control rather than fast scaling with loans/partners. 'Don't want to grow fast'

interest_level.label: interested_practical_suggestions
evidence: Said facilitation is solution to challenges early entrepreneurs face
Willing to contribute percentage of revenue when project grows
Suggested revenue tier groupings for fairness
interest_level.note: Practical, fairness-oriented thinking about cooperative design

concerns_raised.quote: If revenues are mixed, it would be more difficult. Grouping by small/medium/large would be more fair
concerns_raised.solution_proposed: Tier system: very beginner, 10K range, above

co_design_contributions.description: Suggested 3 tiers: very beginners, 10K/year range, above. Each tier has own circle, all connected at end
co_design_contributions.reasoning: More fair for businesses at different stages. Mixed revenues too complex

readiness_assessment.reasoning: Strong environmental values and practical growth mindset. Just completed major infrastructure scale-up (5x expansion) but not yet producing from new setup. Financial planning phase. Good candidate once new revenue streams stabilize. Risk: capital-intensive phase (needs $2.5-3K for solar). Strength: Clear path to profitability, B2C + future B2B model.

support_needed: Crowdfunding campaign design for solar panels
recommendation.unique_value: AgriTech innovation, environmental sustainability champion, South Lebanon representation, organic food access mission
recommendation.special_note: Connection to Hitaf (Bilal's contact) for solar energy collaboration opportunity

hitaf_solar_energy_collaboration.description: Bilal knows Hitaf who works on solar/green energy projects. Can help Ghinwa with solar panel setup and potentially grant writing

specifics.ghinwa_need: 10 amps power, ~10 solar panels + batteries + inverter
specifics.hitaf_expertise: Solar energy, grant writing, green projects

hitaf_solar_energy_collaboration.action_required: Bilal intro to Hitaf → technical consultation → possible joint grant application

beit_al_atlas_rooftop_pilot.description: Bilal's house (Beit Al Atlas, Beirut) has solar panels, rooftop garden, established community space. Ghinwa could install home hydroponics system as pilot/demo

specifics.existing_infrastructure: Solar panels, rooftop garden with avocados/tomatoes/plants
specifics.value_for_ghinwa: Showcase for home product, urban pilot, photography/marketing, proof of concept
specifics.value_for_bilal: Fresh vegetables, rooftop optimization, content for community
specifics.modular_requirement: Must be removable if Bilal moves

beit_al_atlas_rooftop_pilot.action_required: Ghinwa designs modular home kit → Bilal funds installation → documentation/showcase

bloom_network_crowdfunding.description: Crowdfunding campaign for Urban Leaf via Bloom network (14,000 people) + Ghinwa's community

tiered_goals.$30,000: Full expansion (2 more tents + solar + infrastructure)

bilal_recommendation.pitch: If each person gives $0.50, it's done

bloom_network_crowdfunding.perks_ideas: Visit farm, salad delivery, hydroponics workshop, support local organic farming
bloom_network_crowdfunding.action_required: Ghinwa designs campaign → Bloom amplifies via newsletter/social → Jad (marketing expert in network) helps

ihab_youth_training_collaboration.description: Ihab (ACSI4 cohort mate) works with youth in his neighborhood on entrepreneurship training. Ghinwa could share her story + hydroponics concept
ihab_youth_training_collaboration.action_required: Bilal connects Ghinwa + Ihab → Ghinwa does workshop/talk about agricultural entrepreneurship

key_quotes.on_expansion: We started with a small hydroponics tent, 25 square meters under stairs. Then we got new land and expanded the tent from 25m² to 126m². With help of Bloom and Berytech fund, this really helped us make the shift at a good time
key_quotes.on_environment: Hydroponics needs electricity to keep running. We want to use renewable energy so we don't harm the environment. This is what we'll invest in personally because we know in the end it will have good return for us long-term
key_quotes.on_secret_sauce: The secret sauce is introducing the hydroponics concept to the community we're in. We first present the idea to people around us. We're getting them used to buying clean vegetables from us. When they reach the point where they say 'yes, we're interested in having hydroponics at home,' then we'll have clean vegetables
key_quotes.on_cooperative_fairness: I think it will be more fair for businesses if they're small, medium, or large enterprises. Mixed revenues is more difficult
key_quotes.on_growth_philosophy: Dream big. But let me tell you, I don't want to grow fast. I want to grow slowly, not fast. I don't want loans and commitments. I'd rather have baby steps where I'm in full control

growth_edges: Capital needs for solar (main cost barrier)
meta_insights.unique_contribution: AgriTech hydroponics innovation, environmental sustainability champion, South Lebanon rural representation, organic food access mission, patient growth mindset
